headline: Why Capital One (COF) Faces New Questions on Regulatory Risk After FDIC Lawsuit Over Deposit Assessments
summary: In November 2025, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) filed a lawsuit against Capital One Financial, alleging the company underpaid its required contributions for the 2023 depositor bailout following the failures of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank. In response, Capital One initiated its own legal action against the FDIC, arguing that the regulator's assessment method resulted in excessive charges linked to a disputed reporting of uninsured deposit balances. This legal...
